executive_summary.business_impact: Moderate security risks present - should be addressed within 30 days to prevent potential incidents.
executive_summary.recommendation: Implement remediation plan within 30-60 days to achieve acceptable security posture.

technical_findings.title: Weak SSL/TLS Configuration
technical_findings.business_risk: Moderate - Should be addressed to prevent future incidents
technical_findings.description: SSL certificate uses weak encryption algorithms
technical_findings.evidence: example-client.com supports TLS 1.0 and weak cipher suites
technical_findings.remediation: Disable TLS 1.0/1.1, implement strong ciphers only

technical_findings.title: Missing Security Headers
technical_findings.business_risk: Moderate - Should be addressed to prevent future incidents
technical_findings.potential_impact: Clickjacking, XSS, and session hijacking vulnerabilities

technical_findings.title: Outdated Software Version
technical_findings.evidence: Server headers indicate outdated software version

short_term_actions: Resolve Weak SSL/TLS Configuration - Disable TLS 1.0/1.1, implement strong ciphers only
Resolve Missing Security Headers - Implement X-Frame-Options, CSP, HSTS headers
long_term_actions: Improve Outdated Software Version - Update to latest stable version

compliance_notes:

• Industry Standards: Security headers are considered best practice
        

RECOMMENDATION:
Implement identified security measures to maintain regulatory compliance
and industry best practices. Consider periodic security assessments to
maintain ongoing compliance.
